original: 或日一食，以一食為足，或二、三、四、五、六、七日、半月、一月一食，以一食為足；🔽或食菜茹，或食稗子，或食穄米，或食雜󰎣，或食頭頭邏食，或食麤食；
analyzed: 或日一食，以一食為足，或二、三、四、五、六、七日、半月、一月一食，以一食為足； 或食菜茹，或食稗子，或食穄米，或食雜󰎣，或食頭頭邏食，或食麤食；
translated: Some ate once a day and considered one meal sufficient, some ate once every two, three, four, five, six, seven days, half a month, or a month and considered one meal sufficient;🔽Some ate vegetables, some ate barnyard millet, some ate glutinous rice, some ate a mixture of grains, some ate tuoluo food, some ate coarse food;

original: 或至無事處，依於無事，或食根，或食果，或食自落果，或持連合衣，或持毛衣，或持頭舍衣，或持毛頭舍衣，或持全皮，或持穿皮，或持全穿皮；
analyzed: 或至無事處，依於無事，或食根，或食果，或食自落果，或持連合衣，或持毛衣，或持頭舍衣，或持毛頭舍衣，或持全皮，或持穿皮，或持全穿皮；
translated: Some went to secluded places, relied on seclusion, ate roots, ate fruits, ate naturally fallen fruits, wore patched robes, wore woolen robes, wore robes made of head hair, wore robes made of hair tips, wore whole leather, wore perforated leather, or wore whole perforated leather;

original: 或持散髮，或持編髮，或持散編髮，或有剃髮，或有剃鬚，或剃鬚髮，或有拔髮，或有拔鬚，或拔鬚髮；
analyzed: 或持散髮，或持編髮，或持散編髮，或有剃髮，或有剃鬚，或剃鬚髮，或有拔髮，或有拔鬚，或拔鬚髮；
translated: Some held loose hair, some held braided hair, some held loose braided hair, some shaved their heads, some shaved their beards, some shaved their beards and hair, some pulled out their hair, some pulled out their beards, some pulled out their beards and hair;

original: 或住立斷坐，或修蹲行，或有臥刺，以刺為床，或有臥果，以果為床，或有事水，晝夜手抒，或有事火，竟昔然之，或事日、月、尊祐大德，叉手向彼，如此之比受無量苦，學煩熱行。
analyzed: 或住立斷坐，或修蹲行，或有臥刺，以刺為床，或有臥果，以果為床，或有事水，晝夜手抒，或有事火，竟昔然之，或事日、月、尊祐大德，叉手向彼，如此之比受無量苦，學煩熱行。
translated: Some stood and abstained from sitting, some practiced squatting, some slept on thorns, using thorns as a bed, some slept on fruits, using fruits as a bed, some served water, stirring it with their hands day and night, some served fire, burning it all day, some served the sun and moon, venerating the great virtuous ones with clasped hands towards them. In this way, they underwent immeasurable suffering, learning the practice of torment.
Siṃha!
I do not say that these ascetic practices do not exist.
Siṃha!

original: 然此苦行為下賤業，至苦至困，凡人所行，非是聖道。
analyzed: 然此苦行為下賤業，至苦至困，凡人所行，非是聖道。
translated: However, these ascetic practices are lowly deeds, reaching suffering and hardship, practiced by ordinary people, not the noble path.
Siṃha!

original: 若有沙門、梵志，彼苦行法知斷滅盡，拔絕其根，至竟不生者，我說彼苦行。
analyzed: 若有沙門、梵志，彼苦行法知斷滅盡，拔絕其根，至竟不生者，我說彼苦行。
translated: If there are śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas who know the cessation and complete destruction of the dharmas of ascetic practices, uprooting them so that they do not arise again, I say that is asceticism.
Siṃha!

original: 如來、無所著、等正覺，彼苦行法知斷滅盡，拔絕其根，至竟不生，是故我苦行。
analyzed: 如來、無所著、等正覺，彼苦行法知斷滅盡，拔絕其根，至竟不生，是故我苦行。
translated: The Tathāgata, free from attachment and fully awakened, knows the cessation and complete destruction of the dharmas of ascetic practices, uprooting them so that they do not arise again. Therefore, my asceticism.
Siṃha!

original: 是謂有事因此事故，於如實法不能謗毀，沙門瞿曇宗本苦行，亦為人說苦行之法。
analyzed: 是謂有事因此事故，於如實法不能謗毀，沙門瞿曇宗本苦行，亦為人說苦行之法。
translated: This is called a matter on account of which one cannot slander the true Dharma, saying that the śramaṇa Gautama's fundamental practice is asceticism, and he also teaches the Dharma of asceticism for others.
Siṃha!

original: 云何復有事因此事故，於如實法不能謗毀，沙門瞿曇宗本不入於胎，亦為人說不入胎法？
analyzed: 云何復有事因此事故，於如實法不能謗毀，沙門瞿曇宗本不入於胎，亦為人說不入胎法？
translated: How is there another matter on account of which one cannot slander the true Dharma, saying that the śramaṇa Gautama's fundamental practice is not entering the womb, and he also teaches the Dharma of not entering the womb for others?
Siṃha!🔽Siṃha!Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: 若有沙門、梵志當來胎生，知斷滅盡，拔絕其根，至竟不生者，我說彼不入於胎。
analyzed: 若有沙門、梵志當來胎生，知斷滅盡，拔絕其根，至竟不生者，我說彼不入於胎。
translated: If there are ascetics and brahmins who, when born from a womb in the future, know to cut off and end [rebirth], uproot it, and make it not arise again, I say they will not enter a womb.
Siṃha!

original: 如來、無所著、等正覺，當來有胎生知斷滅盡，拔絕其根，至竟不生，是故我不入於胎。
analyzed: 如來、無所著、等正覺，當來有胎生知斷滅盡，拔絕其根，至竟不生，是故我不入於胎。
translated: The Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, when born from a womb in the future, knows to cut off and end [rebirth], uproots it, and makes it not arise again. Therefore, I do not enter a womb.
Siṃha!

original: 是謂有事因此事故，於如實法不能謗毀，沙門瞿曇宗本不入於胎，亦為人說不入胎法。
analyzed: 是謂有事因此事故，於如實法不能謗毀，沙門瞿曇宗本不入於胎，亦為人說不入胎法。
translated: This is called a matter because of which one cannot slander the true Dharma, saying that the Śramaṇa Gautama's fundamental teaching is not entering a womb, and he also teaches the Dharma of not entering a womb for others.
Siṃha!

original: 云何復有事因此事故，於如實法不能謗毀，沙門瞿曇宗本安隱，亦為人說安隱之法？
analyzed: 云何復有事因此事故，於如實法不能謗毀，沙門瞿曇宗本安隱，亦為人說安隱之法？
translated: How is there another matter because of which one cannot slander the true Dharma, saying that the Śramaṇa Gautama's fundamental teaching is tranquility, and he also teaches the Dharma of tranquility for others?
Siṃha!

original: 族姓子所有剃除鬚髮，著袈裟衣，至信、捨家、無家、學道者，唯無上梵行訖，我於現法自知自覺，自作證成就遊，生已盡，梵行已立，所作已辦，不更受有，知如真，我自安隱，亦安隱他比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷。
analyzed: 族姓子所有剃除鬚髮，著袈裟衣，至信、捨家、無家、學道者，唯無上梵行訖，我於現法自知自覺，自作證成就遊，生已盡，梵行已立，所作已辦，不更受有，知如真，我自安隱，亦安隱他比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷。
translated: Son of good family, those who shave their beards and hair, put on the dyed robe, leave home out of faith, become homeless, and practice the path, only complete the unsurpassed holy life. I know and realize it myself in the present world, and I accomplish and dwell in it. Birth is ended, the holy life has been fulfilled, what was to be done has been done, there will not be another existence. I myself am at ease, and I also bring ease to other monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.

original: 我已安彼，便為生法，眾生於生法解脫，老法、病法、死法、憂慼染汙法，眾生於憂慼染污法解脫。
analyzed: 我已安彼，便為生法，眾生於生法解脫，老法、病法、死法、憂慼染汙法，眾生於憂慼染污法解脫。
translated: I have brought peace to them, and they are liberated from the dharma of birth, the dharma of old age, the dharma of sickness, the dharma of death, the dharma of sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish. Beings are liberated from the dharma of sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish.
Siṃha!

original: 是謂有事因此事故，於如實法不能謗毀，沙門瞿曇宗本安隱，亦為人說安隱之法。
analyzed: 是謂有事因此事故，於如實法不能謗毀，沙門瞿曇宗本安隱，亦為人說安隱之法。
translated: This is called an event that, because of this matter, cannot be slandered as being contrary to the true Dharma. The basis of the Śramaṇa Gautama is peace, and he also teaches the Dharma of peace to others.
The great minister Siṃha said to the Bhagavān:
Gautama!
I have understood.
Well-Gone One!
I have comprehended.
Gautama!

original: 猶明目人，覆者仰之，覆者發之，迷者示道，闇中施明，若有眼者，便見於色。
analyzed: 猶明目人，覆者仰之，覆者發之，迷者示道，闇中施明，若有眼者，便見於色。
translated: It is like a person with clear eyes, who tilts the covered and reveals the covered, shows the way to the confused, and provides light in the dark, so that those with eyes can see forms.

original: 沙門瞿曇亦復如是，為我無量方便說法、現義，隨其諸道。
analyzed: 沙門瞿曇亦復如是，為我無量方便說法、現義，隨其諸道。
translated: The Śramaṇa Gautama is also like this. He has used countless skillful means to teach the Dharma and reveal the meaning for me, according to the various paths.
World-Honored One!

original: 我今自歸於佛、法及比丘眾，唯願世尊受我為優婆塞，從今日始，終身自歸，乃至命盡。
analyzed: 我今自歸於佛、法及比丘眾，唯願世尊受我為優婆塞，從今日始，終身自歸，乃至命盡。
translated: I now take refuge in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha of bhikṣus. May the World-Honored One accept me as an upāsaka. From this day forth, for as long as I live, I take refuge and will not take another master.
World-Honored One!

original: 猶如有人養不良馬，望得其利，徒自疲勞而不獲利。
analyzed: 猶如有人養不良馬，望得其利，徒自疲勞而不獲利。
translated: It is like a person raising a bad horse, hoping to gain profit, but only exhausting himself without gaining any profit.
World-Honored One!

original: 我亦如是，彼愚癡尼乾不善曉了，不能自知，不識良田而不自審，長夜奉敬，供養禮事，望得其利，唐苦無益。
analyzed: 我亦如是，彼愚癡尼乾不善曉了，不能自知，不識良田而不自審，長夜奉敬，供養禮事，望得其利，唐苦無益。
translated: I am also like this. That foolish Nirgrantha did not understand well, could not know for himself, did not recognize the good field, and did not examine himself. For a long time he revered, made offerings, paid homage, and hoped to gain benefits, but it was in vain and useless.
World-Honored One!

original: 我今再自歸佛、法及比丘眾，唯願世尊受我為優婆塞，從今日始，終身自歸，乃至命盡。
analyzed: 我今再自歸佛、法及比丘眾，唯願世尊受我為優婆塞，從今日始，終身自歸，乃至命盡。
translated: I now again take refuge in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha. I only wish that the World-Honored One would accept me as a lay disciple. From this day forth, for as long as I live, I take refuge and will not take another master.
World-Honored One!

original: 我本無知，於愚癡尼乾有信有敬，從今日斷。
analyzed: 我本無知，於愚癡尼乾有信有敬，從今日斷。
translated: I was originally ignorant and had faith and respect for the foolish Nirgrantha. From today, I will cut it off.
Why is it so?
Because he deceived me.
World-Honored One!

original: 我今三自歸佛、法及比丘眾，唯願世尊受我為優婆塞，從今日始，終身自歸，乃至命盡。
analyzed: 我今三自歸佛、法及比丘眾，唯願世尊受我為優婆塞，從今日始，終身自歸，乃至命盡。
translated: I now take refuge in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha for a third time. I only wish that the World-Honored One would accept me as a lay disciple. From this day forth, for as long as I live, I take refuge and will not take another master.
The Buddha spoke like this.

original: 師子大臣及諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
analyzed: 師子大臣及諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translated: The great minister Shizi and the bhikṣus heard what the Buddha said, and joyfully undertook to follow it.

original: 師子經第八竟二千四百一十三字19 尼乾經（一九）中阿含業相應品尼乾經第九初一日誦我聞如是：
analyzed: 師子經第八竟二千四百一十三字19 尼乾經（一九）中阿含業相應品尼乾經第九初一日誦我聞如是：
translated: Nigaṇṭha Sūtra (19) In the Middle Length Āgamas, the Chapter on Karma, the Nigaṇṭha Sūtra, the Ninth, the First Day's Recitation I have heard thus:

original: 一時，佛遊釋羇瘦，在天邑中。
analyzed: 一時，佛遊釋羇瘦，在天邑中。
translated: Once, the Buddha was wandering among the Śākyas, in the city of Devadaha.
At that time, the World-Honored One told the bhikṣus:

original: 「諸尼乾等如是見、如是說，謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊。
analyzed: 「諸尼乾等如是見、如是說，謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊。
translated: The Nigaṇṭhas have such views and make such statements: 'Whatever a person experiences is due to what he did in the past. If one can end past karma through ascetic practices and does not create new karma, then all karma will be exhausted. When all karma is exhausted, one can end suffering. When one ends suffering, one reaches the end of suffering.'
I then went to them and, upon arrival, asked:
'Nigaṇṭhas!

original: 汝等實如是見、如是說，謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊耶？
analyzed: 汝等實如是見、如是說，謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊耶？
translated: Do you really see and say that what a person experiences is all due to past actions, that if one ends past actions through ascetic practices, and does not create new ones, then all actions will be exhausted, all actions exhausted, then one will attain the end of suffering, having attained the end of suffering, one will reach the limit of suffering?
They replied to me,
It is so.
Gautama!
I further asked those Nirgranthas,

original: 『汝等自有淨智，我為本有，我為本無，我為本作惡，為不作惡，我為爾所苦盡，為爾所苦不盡，若盡已，便得盡，即於現世斷諸不善，得眾善法，修習作證耶？
analyzed: 『汝等自有淨智，我為本有，我為本無，我為本作惡，為不作惡，我為爾所苦盡，為爾所苦不盡，若盡已，便得盡，即於現世斷諸不善，得眾善法，修習作證耶？
translated: Do you have pure knowledge yourselves, that you say 'I existed in the past,' 'I did not exist in the past,' 'I did evil in the past,' 'I did not do evil,' 'I will end so much suffering,' 'I will not end so much suffering,' if it is exhausted, then one will attain the end, and in this very life, one will cut off all that is unwholesome, and attain the many wholesome dharmas, and cultivate and realize them?
They replied to me,
No, Gautama!

I further said to those Nirgranthas,🔽You say that what a person experiences is all due to past actions, that if one ends past actions through ascetic practices, and does not create new ones, then all actions will be exhausted, all actions exhausted, then one will attain the end of suffering, having attained the end of suffering, one will reach the limit of suffering, but you do not have pure knowledge yourselves, that you say 'I existed in the past,' 'I did not exist in the past,' 'I did evil in the past,' 'I did not do evil,' 'I will end so much suffering,' 'I will not end so much suffering,' if it is exhausted, then one will attain the end, and in this very life, one will cut off all that is unwholesome, and attain the many wholesome dharmas, and cultivate and realize them.

original: 『汝等自無淨智，我為本有，我為本無，我為本作惡，為不作惡，我為爾所苦盡，為爾所苦不盡，若盡已，便得盡，即於現世斷諸不善，得眾善法，修習作證，而作是說，謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊。
analyzed: 『汝等自無淨智，我為本有，我為本無，我為本作惡，為不作惡，我為爾所苦盡，為爾所苦不盡，若盡已，便得盡，即於現世斷諸不善，得眾善法，修習作證，而作是說，謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊。
translated: 'You yourselves have no pure knowledge. I say that I have an intrinsic nature, that I have no intrinsic nature, that I have previously done evil, that I have not done evil, that I have exhausted so much suffering, that I have not exhausted so much suffering. If exhausted, then I will attain exhaustion. In this very life, I will abandon all that is unwholesome and attain various wholesome qualities, cultivating and realizing them.' They say, 'What a person experiences is all due to previous actions.' If one's past karma is extinguished due to ascetic practices, and one does not create new karma, then all karma is exhausted. When all karma is exhausted, one attains the exhaustion of suffering. Having attained the exhaustion of suffering, one attains the limit of suffering.
Nirgrantha!

original: 若汝等自有淨智，我為本有，我為本無，我為本作惡，為不作惡，我為爾所苦盡，為爾所苦不盡，若盡已，便得盡，即於現世斷諸不善，得眾善法，修習作證。
analyzed: 若汝等自有淨智，我為本有，我為本無，我為本作惡，為不作惡，我為爾所苦盡，為爾所苦不盡，若盡已，便得盡，即於現世斷諸不善，得眾善法，修習作證。
translated: If you yourselves have pure knowledge, I say that I have an intrinsic nature, that I have no intrinsic nature, that I have previously done evil, that I have not done evil, that I have exhausted so much suffering, that I have not exhausted so much suffering. If exhausted, then I will attain exhaustion. In this very life, I will abandon all that is unwholesome and attain various wholesome qualities, cultivating and realizing them.
Nirgrantha!

original: 汝等可得作是說，謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊。
analyzed: 汝等可得作是說，謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊。
translated: You can say that what a person experiences is all due to past actions. If past karma is extinguished by suffering, and no new karma is created, then all karma is exhausted. When all karma is exhausted, one attains the end of suffering. Having attained the end of suffering, one attains the limit of suffering.
Nirgrantha!

original: 猶如有人身被毒箭，因被毒箭則生極苦，彼為親屬憐念愍傷，欲饒益安隱故，即呼拔箭金醫。
analyzed: 猶如有人身被毒箭，因被毒箭則生極苦，彼為親屬憐念愍傷，欲饒益安隱故，即呼拔箭金醫。
translated: It is like a person who is struck by a poisoned arrow. Because of being struck by the poisoned arrow, extreme pain arises. His relatives pity him and wish to benefit and comfort him, so they call a gold-tipped arrow remover.

original: 箭金醫來，便以利刀而為開瘡，因開瘡時，復生極苦，既開瘡已，而求箭金，求箭金時，復生極苦，求得金已，即便拔出，因拔出時，復生極苦，拔金出已，薄瘡纏裹，因裹瘡時，復生極苦，彼於拔箭金後，得力無患，不壞諸根，平復如故。
analyzed: 箭金醫來，便以利刀而為開瘡，因開瘡時，復生極苦，既開瘡已，而求箭金，求箭金時，復生極苦，求得金已，即便拔出，因拔出時，復生極苦，拔金出已，薄瘡纏裹，因裹瘡時，復生極苦，彼於拔箭金後，得力無患，不壞諸根，平復如故。
translated: The gold-tipped arrow doctor came and with a sharp knife opened the wound. When opening the wound, he again experienced extreme pain. After opening the wound, he sought the gold-tipped arrow. When seeking the gold-tipped arrow, he again experienced extreme pain. After finding the gold, he then pulled it out. When pulling it out, he again experienced extreme pain. After pulling out the gold, he bandaged the wound. When bandaging the wound, he again experienced extreme pain. After pulling out the gold-tipped arrow, he regained strength, was free from illness, and his faculties were not impaired, returning to normal.
Nirgrantha!

original: 彼人自有淨智，便作是念：
analyzed: 彼人自有淨智，便作是念：
translated: That person had pure knowledge himself and thought like this:

original: 『我本被毒箭，因被毒箭，則生極苦，我諸親屬見憐念愍傷，欲饒益安隱我故，即呼拔箭金醫，箭金醫來，便以利刀為我開瘡，因開瘡時，復生極苦，既開瘡已，而求箭金，求箭金時，復生極苦，求得金已，即便拔出，因拔出時，復生極苦，拔金出已，薄瘡纏裹，因裹瘡時，復生極苦，我於拔箭金後，得力無患，不壞諸根，平復如故。
analyzed: 『我本被毒箭，因被毒箭，則生極苦，我諸親屬見憐念愍傷，欲饒益安隱我故，即呼拔箭金醫，箭金醫來，便以利刀為我開瘡，因開瘡時，復生極苦，既開瘡已，而求箭金，求箭金時，復生極苦，求得金已，即便拔出，因拔出時，復生極苦，拔金出已，薄瘡纏裹，因裹瘡時，復生極苦，我於拔箭金後，得力無患，不壞諸根，平復如故。
translated: 'I was originally struck by a poisoned arrow, and because of being struck by the poisoned arrow, I experienced extreme pain. My relatives, out of pity and compassion, wishing to benefit and comfort me, immediately called for a gold arrow-puller. The gold arrow-puller came and used a sharp knife to open my wound. When opening the wound, I experienced even more extreme pain. After opening the wound, he sought the poisoned arrow. When seeking the poisoned arrow, I experienced even more extreme pain. After finding the poisoned arrow, he pulled it out. When pulling it out, I experienced even more extreme pain. After pulling out the poisoned arrow, he wrapped my wound. When wrapping the wound, I experienced even more extreme pain. After the gold arrow-puller left, I regained strength, became free from illness, and my faculties returned to normal, just as before.'
Thus, Nirgrantha!

original: 若汝等自有淨智，我為本有，我為本無，我為本作惡，為不作惡，我為爾所苦盡，為爾所苦不盡，若盡已，便得盡，即於現世斷諸不善，得眾善法，修習作證。
analyzed: 若汝等自有淨智，我為本有，我為本無，我為本作惡，為不作惡，我為爾所苦盡，為爾所苦不盡，若盡已，便得盡，即於現世斷諸不善，得眾善法，修習作證。
translated: If you have your own pure wisdom, I will be the original existence, I will be the original non-existence, I will be the original doer of evil, or the non-doer of evil, I will be the one who has exhausted so much suffering, or the one who has not exhausted so much suffering. If exhausted, then one attains exhaustion. In this very life, one cuts off all unwholesomeness and attains various wholesome dharmas, cultivating and realizing them.
Nirgranthas!

original: 汝等可得作是說，謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊，我問如是，不見諸尼乾能答我言：
analyzed: 汝等可得作是說，謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊，我問如是，不見諸尼乾能答我言：
translated: You may make this statement, saying that what a person experiences is all due to past actions. If past karma is extinguished due to ascetic practices, and one does not create new karma, then all karma is exhausted. When all karma is exhausted, one attains the exhaustion of suffering. Having attained the exhaustion of suffering, one attains the limit of suffering. I ask this, but I do not see any Nirgranthas who can answer me, saying:
'Gautama!
It is like this, or it is not like this.'
Furthermore, I asked the Nirgranthas:

original: 『若諸尼乾有上斷、上苦行，爾時諸尼乾生上苦耶？
analyzed: 『若諸尼乾有上斷、上苦行，爾時諸尼乾生上苦耶？
translated: 'If the Nirgranthas have the highest cutting off and the highest ascetic practices, then do the Nirgranthas give rise to the highest suffering at that time?
They replied to me,
'Yes, it is so.
Gautama!

analyzed: 』『若有中斷、中苦行，爾時諸尼乾生中苦耶？
translated: ' I said, 'If there is an upper cessation and upper practice of austerities, then at that time the Ājīvakas will experience upper suffering,
' They replied to me,
'Yes, Gautama!

analyzed: 』『若有下斷、下苦行，爾時諸尼乾生下苦耶？

' They replied to me,
'Yes, Gautama!

analyzed: 』是為諸尼乾有上斷、上苦行，爾時諸尼乾則生上苦；
translated: ' This is how the Ājīvakas have an upper cessation and upper practice of austerities, then at that time the Ājīvakas will experience upper suffering;

analyzed: 有中斷、中苦行，爾時諸尼乾則生中苦；

translated: If the Ājīvakas have an upper cessation and upper practice of austerities, then at that time the Ājīvakas will cease upper suffering;

translated: if there is a middle cessation and middle practice of austerities, then at that time the Ājīvakas will cease middle suffering;

analyzed: 有下斷、下苦行，爾時諸尼乾止息下苦。
translated: There are lower forms of cutting and lower forms of ascetic practices. At that time, the Jains stop the lower forms of suffering.

original: 若如是作、不如是作，止息極苦甚重苦者，當知諸尼乾即於現世作苦。
analyzed: 若如是作、不如是作，止息極苦甚重苦者，當知諸尼乾即於現世作苦。
translated: If one acts in this way or not in this way, and stops the extreme suffering and very heavy suffering, one should know that the Jains create suffering in this very life.

analyzed: 但諸尼乾為癡所覆，為癡所纏，而作是說：
translated: But the Jains, being covered by delusion and bound by delusion, say:

analyzed: 『謂人所受皆因本作，若其故業因苦行滅，不造新者，則諸業盡，諸業盡已，則得苦盡，得苦盡已，則得苦邊。
translated: What a person experiences is all due to past actions. If past actions are extinguished due to ascetic practices, and if no new ones are created, then all actions will be exhausted. When all actions are exhausted, one will attain the end of suffering.

analyzed: 』我問如是，不見諸尼乾能答我言：

Gautama!

Jains!

They replied to me,🔽'No, Gautama.
No, Gautama.🔽🔽
'All Nirgranthas,

analyzed: 若有後生報業，彼業寧可因斷、因苦行，轉作現法報耶？
translated: if there is an action with retribution in the next life, can that action be transformed into retribution in the present life by means of cutting and ascetic practices?🔽'
They replied to me,🔽'No, Gautama.
No, Gautama.🔽🔽
'All Nirgranthas,

analyzed: 若有不熟報業，彼業寧可因斷、因苦行，轉作熟報耶？

They replied to me,
'No, Gautama.'
'All of you Nirgranthas,

analyzed: 若有熟報業，彼業寧可因斷、因苦行，轉作異耶？
translated: if there is a karma that is to be experienced, can that karma be changed by cutting or by austerities?'
They replied to me,
'No, Gautama.'
'All of you Nirgranthas,

analyzed: 是為樂報業，彼業不可因斷、因苦行，轉作苦報。
translated: this is karma that is to be experienced as pleasure, that karma cannot be changed by cutting or by austerities to be experienced as suffering.
All of you Nirgranthas,

analyzed: 苦報業，彼業不可因斷、因苦行，轉作樂報。
translated: karma that is to be experienced as suffering, that karma cannot be changed by cutting or by austerities to be experienced as pleasure.
All of you Nirgranthas,

analyzed: 現法報業，彼業不可因斷、因苦行，轉作後生報。
translated: karma that is to be experienced in this very life, that karma cannot be changed by cutting or by austerities to be experienced in a future life.
All of you Nirgranthas,

original: 後生報業，彼業不可因斷、因苦行，轉作現法報。
analyzed: 後生報業，彼業不可因斷、因苦行，轉作現法報。
translated: karma that is to be experienced in a future life, that karma cannot be changed by cutting or by austerities to be experienced in this very life.
All of you Nirgranthas,

analyzed: 不熟業，彼業不可因斷、因苦行，轉作熟報。
translated: karma that is not to be experienced, that karma cannot be changed by cutting or by austerities to be experienced.
All of you Nirgranthas,

analyzed: 熟報業，彼業不可因斷、因苦行，轉作異者。
translated: The retribution of mature karma cannot be changed by cutting or ascetic practices.
Therefore, Nirgranthas,
your false methods are empty cutting without any gain.
' Those Nirgranthas then replied to me,
'Gautama!

original: 我有尊師，名親子尼乾，作如是說：
analyzed: 我有尊師，名親子尼乾，作如是說：
translated: We have a venerable teacher named Pārāśarya Nirgrantha, who says:
Nirgranthas!

original: 汝等若本作惡業，彼業皆可因此苦行而得滅盡，若今護身、口、意，因此不復更作惡業也。
analyzed: 汝等若本作惡業，彼業皆可因此苦行而得滅盡，若今護身、口、意，因此不復更作惡業也。
translated: If you have previously committed evil karma, you can all make it completely disappear through these ascetic practices. If you now protect your body, speech, and mind, you will not commit any more evil karma.
I further asked those Nirgranthas,

analyzed: 『汝等信尊師親子尼乾，不疑惑耶？
translated: 'Do you have faith in your venerable teacher Pārāśarya Nirgrantha, without doubt or confusion?'
They replied to me,
'Gautama!

analyzed: 我信尊師親子尼乾，無有疑惑。
translated: We have faith in our venerable teacher Pārāśarya Nirgrantha, without doubt or confusion.'
I further said to those Nirgranthas,

analyzed: 『有五種法現世二報，信、樂、聞、念、見善觀，諸尼乾！
translated: 'There are five dharmas that have two results in the present world, namely faith, joy, hearing, mindfulness, and seeing good observation. O Nirgranthas!

original: 人自有虛妄言，是可信、可樂、可聞、可念、可見善觀耶？
analyzed: 人自有虛妄言，是可信、可樂、可聞、可念、可見善觀耶？
translated: Can a person's own false speech be trusted, enjoyed, heard, remembered, and well observed?'
They replied to me, saying:
'It is so.
Gautama!'
I further said to those Nirgranthas:

original: 『是虛妄言，何可信，何可樂，何可聞，何可念，何可善觀？
analyzed: 『是虛妄言，何可信，何可樂，何可聞，何可念，何可善觀？
translated: 'How can false speech be trusted, enjoyed, heard, remembered, and well observed?

original: 謂人自有虛妄言，有信、有樂、有聞、有念、有善觀。
analyzed: 謂人自有虛妄言，有信、有樂、有聞、有念、有善觀。
translated: It means that a person's own false speech can be trusted, enjoyed, heard, remembered, and well observed.'

original: 』「若諸尼乾作是說者，於如法中得五詰責，為可憎惡。
analyzed: 』「若諸尼乾作是說者，於如法中得五詰責，為可憎惡。
translated: If the Nirgranthas say this, they will be faulted five times in accordance with the Dharma and will be despised.
What are the five?

original: 今此眾生所受苦樂皆因本作，若爾者，諸尼乾等本作惡業。
analyzed: 今此眾生所受苦樂皆因本作，若爾者，諸尼乾等本作惡業。
translated: Now, the suffering and happiness experienced by sentient beings are all due to their past actions. If so, then the Nirgranthas and others have committed evil actions in the past.
Why is it so?

analyzed: 因彼故，諸尼乾於今受極重苦，是謂尼乾第一可憎惡。

Why is it so?

analyzed: 因彼故，諸尼乾於今受極重苦，是謂尼乾第二可憎惡。

translated: Furthermore, the suffering and happiness experienced by sentient beings are all due to their lives. If so, the Jains and others originally had evil lives.

analyzed: 因彼故，諸尼乾於今受極重苦，是謂尼乾第三可憎惡。

analyzed: 若爾者，諸尼乾等本有惡見。
translated: If so, the Jains and others originally had evil views.
Why is it so?

analyzed: 因彼故，諸尼乾於今受極重苦，是謂尼乾第四可憎惡。
translated: Because of this, the Jains now experience extremely severe suffering. This is called the fourth contemptible thing about the Jains.

analyzed: 復次，眾生所受苦樂皆因尊祐造，若爾者，諸尼乾等本惡尊祐。
translated: Furthermore, if sentient beings' suffering and happiness are all created by a supreme being, then the Jains' supreme being is evil.
Why is this?

analyzed: 因彼故，諸尼乾於今受極重苦，是謂尼乾第五可憎惡。
translated: Because of this, the Jains now experience extremely severe suffering. This is called the fifth contemptible thing about the Jains.

analyzed: 若諸尼乾因本所作惡業、惡合會、惡為命、惡見、惡尊祐，為惡尊祐所造，因彼故，諸尼乾於今受極重苦，是謂因彼事故，諸尼乾等為可憎惡。
translated: If the Jains' evil deeds, evil gatherings, evil livelihood, evil views, and evil supreme being were created by an evil supreme being, because of this, the Jains now experience extremely severe suffering. This is called the reason why the Jains are contemptible.

analyzed: 云何我所自知、自覺法為汝說者，非為沙門、梵志，若天、魔、梵及餘世間所能伏、所能穢、所能制？
translated: How is it that I have attained the Dharma through self-realization and self-enlightenment, which cannot be subdued, defiled, or controlled by ascetics, brahmins, gods, demons, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world?

original: 若有比丘捨身不善業，修身善業，捨口、意不善業，修口、意善業，彼於未來苦，便自知我無未來苦，如法得樂而不棄捨。
analyzed: 若有比丘捨身不善業，修身善業，捨口、意不善業，修口、意善業，彼於未來苦，便自知我無未來苦，如法得樂而不棄捨。
translated: If a bhikṣu abandons unwholesome bodily actions and cultivates wholesome bodily actions, abandons unwholesome verbal and mental actions and cultivates wholesome verbal and mental actions, he will know for himself in the future that he will have no suffering, and will attain happiness according to the Dharma without abandoning it.

original: 彼或欲斷苦因，行欲，或欲斷苦因，行捨欲，彼若欲斷苦因，行欲者，即修其行欲，已斷者，苦便得盡。
analyzed: 彼或欲斷苦因，行欲，或欲斷苦因，行捨欲，彼若欲斷苦因，行欲者，即修其行欲，已斷者，苦便得盡。
translated: If he wishes to end the cause of suffering, he may practice desire or practice the abandonment of desire. If he wishes to end the cause of suffering and practices desire, he will cultivate the practice of desire and end it, and suffering will be exhausted.

original: 彼若欲斷苦因，行捨欲者，即修其行捨欲，已斷者，苦便得盡。
analyzed: 彼若欲斷苦因，行捨欲者，即修其行捨欲，已斷者，苦便得盡。
translated: If he wishes to end the cause of suffering and practices the abandonment of desire, he will cultivate the practice of abandoning desire and end it, and suffering will be exhausted.
If that bhikṣu thinks like this:

original: 『隨所為、隨所行，不善法生而善法滅，若自斷苦，不善法滅而善法生，我今寧可自斷其苦。
analyzed: 『隨所為、隨所行，不善法生而善法滅，若自斷苦，不善法滅而善法生，我今寧可自斷其苦。
translated: 'Whatever I do and wherever I go, unwholesome states arise and wholesome states diminish. If I were to end my own suffering, unwholesome states would diminish and wholesome states would increase. I should now end my own suffering.'
He then ended his own suffering.

original: 自斷苦已，不善法滅而善法生，不復斷苦。
analyzed: 自斷苦已，不善法滅而善法生，不復斷苦。
translated: After ending his own suffering, unwholesome states diminished and wholesome states increased, and he no longer ended his own suffering.
Why is it so?
Bhikkhus!

original: 本所為者，其義已成，若復斷苦，是處不然。
analyzed: 本所為者，其義已成，若復斷苦，是處不然。
translated: What he originally did, its meaning has already been accomplished. If he were to end his suffering again, this would not be right.
Bhikkhus!

original: 猶如箭工用檢撓箭，其箭已直，不復用檢。
analyzed: 猶如箭工用檢撓箭，其箭已直，不復用檢。
translated: It is just as an arrow-maker uses a string to straighten an arrow. When the arrow is straight, he does not use the string again.
Why is it so?

original: 彼人本所為者，其事已成，若復用檢，是處不然。
analyzed: 彼人本所為者，其事已成，若復用檢，是處不然。
translated: Because what that person originally did, its matter has already been accomplished. If he were to use the string again, this would not be right.
In the same way, the bhikkhu then had this thought:

original: 『隨所為、隨所行，不善法生而善法滅，若自斷苦，不善法滅而善法生，我今寧可自斷其苦。
analyzed: 『隨所為、隨所行，不善法生而善法滅，若自斷苦，不善法滅而善法生，我今寧可自斷其苦。
translated: 'Whatever I do and wherever I go, unwholesome states arise and wholesome states diminish. If I were to end my own suffering, unwholesome states would diminish and wholesome states would arise. I should now end my own suffering.'
He then ended his own suffering.

original: 自斷苦已，不善法滅而善法生，不復斷苦。
analyzed: 自斷苦已，不善法滅而善法生，不復斷苦。
translated: After ending his own suffering, unwholesome states diminished and wholesome states arose, and he no longer ended his own suffering.
Why is that?

original: 本所為者，其義已成，若復斷苦，是處不然。
analyzed: 本所為者，其義已成，若復斷苦，是處不然。
translated: The original purpose has already been accomplished. If he were to end his own suffering again, that would be unreasonable.
Monks!

original: 猶如有人愛念、染著、敬待彼女，然彼女人更與他語，共相問訊，往來止宿，其人因是身心生苦惱，極憂慼耶？
analyzed: 猶如有人愛念、染著、敬待彼女，然彼女人更與他語，共相問訊，往來止宿，其人因是身心生苦惱，極憂慼耶？
translated: Suppose there was a man who loved, was attached to, and respected a woman, but that woman spoke to another man, exchanged greetings with him, went to stay with him. Would that man, because of that, experience mental and physical suffering, extreme distress?'
The monks replied:
'Yes, World-Honored One.
Why is that?

original: 其人於女愛念、染著，極相敬待，而彼女人更與他語，共相問訊，往來止宿，其人身心何得不生苦惱憂慼？
analyzed: 其人於女愛念、染著，極相敬待，而彼女人更與他語，共相問訊，往來止宿，其人身心何得不生苦惱憂慼？
translated: The man would love and be attached to the woman, treat her with utmost respect, but if the woman were to speak to others, exchange greetings with them, come and go, and stay overnight, how could the man's body and mind not give rise to suffering, distress, and worry?
Bhikṣus!
If that man were to think:

original: 『我唐愛念、敬待彼女，然彼女人更與他語，共相問訊，往來止宿，我今寧可因自苦自憂故，斷為彼女愛念、染著耶？
analyzed: 『我唐愛念、敬待彼女，然彼女人更與他語，共相問訊，往來止宿，我今寧可因自苦自憂故，斷為彼女愛念、染著耶？
translated: 'I have loved and respected that woman in vain. She speaks to others, exchanges greetings with them, comes and goes, and stays overnight. I should now cut off my love and attachment to her because of my own suffering and worry.'

original: 』其人於後因自苦自憂故，便斷為彼女愛念、染著。
analyzed: 』其人於後因自苦自憂故，便斷為彼女愛念、染著。
translated: Later, because of his own suffering and worry, he would then cut off his love and attachment to that woman.

original: 若彼女人故與他語，共相問訊，往來止宿，其人於後，身心寧當復生苦惱，極憂慼耶？
analyzed: 若彼女人故與他語，共相問訊，往來止宿，其人於後，身心寧當復生苦惱，極憂慼耶？
translated: If that woman still speaks to others, exchanges greetings with them, comes and goes, and stays overnight, would the man's body and mind later still give rise to suffering, extreme distress, and worry?
The bhikṣus replied:
No, World-Honored One!
Why is it so?

original: 其人於女無復愛念、染著之情，若彼女人故與他語，共相問訊，往來止宿，若使其人因此身心復生苦惱極憂慼者，是處不然。
analyzed: 其人於女無復愛念、染著之情，若彼女人故與他語，共相問訊，往來止宿，若使其人因此身心復生苦惱極憂慼者，是處不然。
translated: If that person no longer has any affection or attachment towards the woman, and if that woman still talks to others, greets them, comes and goes, and stays overnight, causing that person to again experience suffering and extreme distress, this is not the case.
In this way, the bhikṣu thinks like this:

original: 『隨所為、隨所行，不善法生而善法滅，若自斷其苦，不善法滅而善法生，我今寧可自斷其苦。
analyzed: 『隨所為、隨所行，不善法生而善法滅，若自斷其苦，不善法滅而善法生，我今寧可自斷其苦。
translated: 'According to what is done and what is practiced, unwholesome dharmas arise and wholesome dharmas cease. If one cuts off one's own suffering, unwholesome dharmas cease and wholesome dharmas arise. I should now cut off my own suffering.
' He then cuts off his own suffering.

original: 自斷苦已，不善法滅而善法生，不復斷苦。
analyzed: 自斷苦已，不善法滅而善法生，不復斷苦。
translated: After cutting off his own suffering, unwholesome dharmas cease and wholesome dharmas arise. He no longer cuts off his suffering.
Why is it so?

original: 本所為者，其義已成，若復斷苦，是處不然。
analyzed: 本所為者，其義已成，若復斷苦，是處不然。
translated: The original purpose has already been accomplished. If he cuts off his suffering again, this is not the case.
He further thinks like this:

original: 『若有所因，斷其苦者，我便已斷，然我於欲猶故未斷，我今寧可求斷於欲。
analyzed: 『若有所因，斷其苦者，我便已斷，然我於欲猶故未斷，我今寧可求斷於欲。
translated: 'If there is a cause for this, and if cutting it off would end my suffering, then I would have already cut it off. However, I have not yet cut off desire. I should now seek to cut off desire.'
So he sought to cut off desire.

original: 彼為斷欲故，獨住遠離，在無事處，或至樹下空安靜處，山巖石室、露地穰積，或至林中，或在塚間，彼已在無事處，或至樹下空安靜處，敷尼師檀，結加趺坐，正身正願，反念不向，斷除貪伺，心無有諍，見他財物諸生活具不起貪伺，欲令我得，彼於貪伺淨除其心。
analyzed: 彼為斷欲故，獨住遠離，在無事處，或至樹下空安靜處，山巖石室、露地穰積，或至林中，或在塚間，彼已在無事處，或至樹下空安靜處，敷尼師檀，結加趺坐，正身正願，反念不向，斷除貪伺，心無有諍，見他財物諸生活具不起貪伺，欲令我得，彼於貪伺淨除其心。
translated: In order to cut off desire, he lived alone in seclusion, in a place free from business, either under a tree or in an empty, quiet place, a mountain cave, a stone chamber, in the open, a straw pile, or in a forest, or in a charnel ground. Having already gone to a place free from business, or under a tree or in an empty, quiet place, he spread out his sitting mat, sat cross-legged, straightened his body, and set his intentions right. He turned his thoughts back, not outward, cut off covetousness, had no disputes in his mind, and did not give rise to covetousness for others' wealth and possessions, wishing to obtain them for himself. He purified his mind of covetousness.

original: 如是，瞋恚、睡眠、掉悔，斷疑、度惑，於諸善法無有猶豫，彼於疑惑淨除其心。
analyzed: 如是，瞋恚、睡眠、掉悔，斷疑、度惑，於諸善法無有猶豫，彼於疑惑淨除其心。
translated: In the same way, he cut off anger, sleepiness, restlessness and remorse, and resolved doubts and confusion. He had no hesitation regarding wholesome dharmas. He purified his mind of doubt.

original: 「彼已斷此五蓋——心穢、慧羸，離欲，離惡不善之法，至得第四禪成就遊。
analyzed: 「彼已斷此五蓋——心穢、慧羸，離欲，離惡不善之法，至得第四禪成就遊。
translated: Having cut off these five hindrances, having weakened the defilements of the mind, he attains and abides in the fourth jhāna, which is neither painful nor pleasant and includes the purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: 彼得如是定，心清淨，無穢無煩，柔軟善住，得不動心，趣向漏盡智通作證，彼便知此苦如真，知此苦習、知此苦滅、知此苦滅道如真，亦知此漏如真，知此漏習、知此漏滅、知此漏滅道如真，彼如是知、如是見已，則欲漏心解脫，有漏、無明漏心解脫，解脫已，便知解脫，生已盡，梵行已立，所作已辦，不更受有，知如真。
analyzed: 彼得如是定，心清淨，無穢無煩，柔軟善住，得不動心，趣向漏盡智通作證，彼便知此苦如真，知此苦習、知此苦滅、知此苦滅道如真，亦知此漏如真，知此漏習、知此漏滅、知此漏滅道如真，彼如是知、如是見已，則欲漏心解脫，有漏、無明漏心解脫，解脫已，便知解脫，生已盡，梵行已立，所作已辦，不更受有，知如真。
translated: Having attained such concentration, his mind is purified and cleansed, without defilements, pliable, workable, and established in immovable equipoise. He directs his mind to the knowledge of the destruction of the taints. He knows as it really is: 'This is suffering,' 'This is the origin of suffering,' 'This is the cessation of suffering,' and 'This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.' He knows as it really is: 'These are the taints,' 'This is the origin of the taints,' 'This is the cessation of the taints,' and 'This is the path leading to the cessation of the taints.' Having known and seen thus, his mind is liberated from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of existence, and from the taint of ignorance. When it is liberated, there arises the knowledge: 'It is liberated.' He knows: 'Birth is ended, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.'

original: 「如來如是正心解脫，得五稱譽，如法無諍，可愛可敬。
analyzed: 「如來如是正心解脫，得五稱譽，如法無諍，可愛可敬。
translated: The Tathāgata, thus rightly liberated in mind, has attained five praises, in accordance with the Dharma, without dispute, lovable and respectable.

original: 云何為五？🔽彼眾生者，所受苦樂皆因本作，若爾者，如來本有妙業，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，是謂如來得第一稱譽。
analyzed: 云何為五？ 彼眾生者，所受苦樂皆因本作，若爾者，如來本有妙業，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，是謂如來得第一稱譽。
translated: What are the five?🔽Those beings' suffering and happiness are all caused by their past actions. If so, the Tathāgata had wonderful actions in the past, and because of them, the Tathāgata now attains the holy, undefiled bliss, peaceful and tranquil, and experiences the bliss of liberation. This is called the Tathāgata's attainment of the first praise.

original: 復次，眾生所受苦樂皆因合會，若爾者，如來本妙合會，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，是謂如來得第二稱譽。
analyzed: 復次，眾生所受苦樂皆因合會，若爾者，如來本妙合會，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，是謂如來得第二稱譽。
translated: Furthermore, the suffering and happiness experienced by beings are all caused by their combination [of causes and conditions]. If so, the Tathāgata had a wonderful combination [of causes and conditions] in the past, and because of them, the Tathāgata now attains the holy, undefiled bliss, peaceful and tranquil, and experiences the bliss of liberation. This is called the Tathāgata's attainment of the second praise.

original: 復次，眾生所受苦樂皆因為命，若爾者，如來本妙為命，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，是謂如來得第三稱譽。🔽復次，眾生所受苦樂皆因見也，若爾者，如來本妙見，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，是謂如來得第四稱譽。
analyzed: 復次，眾生所受苦樂皆因為命，若爾者，如來本妙為命，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，是謂如來得第三稱譽。 復次，眾生所受苦樂皆因見也，若爾者，如來本妙見，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，是謂如來得第四稱譽。
translated: Furthermore, the suffering and happiness experienced by sentient beings are all due to the cause of life. If so, the Tathāgata's original wonderful life is the cause of that. Therefore, the Tathāgata now attains the holy, undefiled bliss, the bliss of tranquility and cessation, and experiences the bliss of awakening. This is called the Tathāgata's attainment of the third praise.🔽Furthermore, the suffering and happiness experienced by sentient beings are all due to views. If so, the Tathāgata's original wonderful views are the cause of that. Therefore, the Tathāgata now attains the holy, undefiled bliss, the bliss of tranquility and cessation, and experiences the bliss of awakening. This is called the Tathāgata's attainment of the fourth praise.

original: 復次，眾生所受苦樂皆因尊祐造，若爾者，如來本妙尊祐，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，是謂如來得第五稱譽。
analyzed: 復次，眾生所受苦樂皆因尊祐造，若爾者，如來本妙尊祐，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，是謂如來得第五稱譽。
translated: Furthermore, the suffering and happiness experienced by sentient beings are all due to the creation of revered blessings. If so, the Tathāgata's original wonderful revered blessings are the cause of that. Therefore, the Tathāgata now attains the holy, undefiled bliss, the bliss of tranquility and cessation, and experiences the bliss of awakening. This is called the Tathāgata's attainment of the fifth praise.

original: 是為如來本妙業、妙合會、妙為命、妙見、妙尊祐，為妙尊祐所造，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，以此事故，如來於今得五稱譽。
analyzed: 是為如來本妙業、妙合會、妙為命、妙見、妙尊祐，為妙尊祐所造，因彼故，如來於今聖無漏樂，寂靜止息而得樂覺，以此事故，如來於今得五稱譽。
translated: This is the Tathāgata's original wondrous karma, wondrous union, wondrous life, wondrous vision, and wondrous blessings. It is created by the wondrous blessings, and because of that, the Tathāgata now attains the holy, undefiled bliss, peaceful cessation, and the realization of bliss. For this reason, the Tathāgata now attains five praises.
There are five causes and conditions that give rise to mental anguish and suffering.
What are the five?

original: 婬欲纏者，因婬欲纏故，心生憂苦。
analyzed: 婬欲纏者，因婬欲纏故，心生憂苦。
translated: One who is bound by sexual desire, due to being bound by sexual desire, gives rise to mental anguish and suffering.

original: 如是，瞋恚、睡眠、掉悔、疑惑纏者，因疑惑纏故，心生憂苦。
analyzed: 如是，瞋恚、睡眠、掉悔、疑惑纏者，因疑惑纏故，心生憂苦。
translated: Similarly, one who is bound by anger, sleep, restlessness, remorse, and doubt, due to being bound by doubt, gives rise to mental anguish and suffering.
These are the five causes and conditions that give rise to mental anguish and suffering.
There are five causes and conditions that extinguish mental anguish and suffering.
What are the five?

original: 若婬欲纏者，因婬欲纏故，心生憂苦，除婬欲纏已，憂苦便滅，因婬欲纏，心生憂苦，於現法中而得究竟，無煩無熱，常住不變，是聖所知、聖所見。
analyzed: 若婬欲纏者，因婬欲纏故，心生憂苦，除婬欲纏已，憂苦便滅，因婬欲纏，心生憂苦，於現法中而得究竟，無煩無熱，常住不變，是聖所知、聖所見。
translated: If one is bound by lust, due to being bound by lust, one's mind gives rise to sorrow and suffering. If one removes the binding of lust, the sorrow and suffering will cease. Due to being bound by lust, one's mind gives rise to sorrow and suffering. In this very life, one attains the ultimate, free from vexation and heat, always abiding and unchanging, which is known and seen by the sages.

original: 如是，瞋恚、睡眠、掉悔，若疑惑纏者，因疑惑纏故，心生憂苦，除疑惑纏已，憂苦便滅，因疑惑纏，心生憂苦，於現法中而得究竟，無煩無熱，常住不變，是聖所知、聖所見。
analyzed: 如是，瞋恚、睡眠、掉悔，若疑惑纏者，因疑惑纏故，心生憂苦，除疑惑纏已，憂苦便滅，因疑惑纏，心生憂苦，於現法中而得究竟，無煩無熱，常住不變，是聖所知、聖所見。
translated: In the same way, if one is bound by anger, sloth, restlessness, remorse, or doubt, due to being bound by doubt, one's mind gives rise to sorrow and suffering. If one removes the binding of doubt, the sorrow and suffering will cease. Due to being bound by doubt, one's mind gives rise to sorrow and suffering. In this very life, one attains the ultimate, free from vexation and heat, always abiding and unchanging, which is known and seen by the sages.
These are the five causes for the cessation of sorrow and suffering in the mind.

original: 「復次，更有現法而得究竟，無煩無熱，常住不變，是聖所知、聖所見。
analyzed: 「復次，更有現法而得究竟，無煩無熱，常住不變，是聖所知、聖所見。
translated: Furthermore, there is another way to attain the ultimate in this very life, free from vexation and heat, always abiding and unchanging, which is known and seen by the sages.

original: 云何更有現法而得究竟，無煩無熱，常住不變，是聖所知、聖所見？
analyzed: 云何更有現法而得究竟，無煩無熱，常住不變，是聖所知、聖所見？
translated: How can there be another present Dharma that can be attained to the end, free from vexation and heat, eternally abiding and unchanging, which is known by the sages and seen by the sages?

original: 謂八支聖道，正見乃至正定，是為八。
analyzed: 謂八支聖道，正見乃至正定，是為八。
translated: It is the eightfold noble path, right view up to right concentration, totaling eight.

original: 是謂更有現法而得究竟，無煩無熱，常住不變，是聖所知、聖所見。
analyzed: 是謂更有現法而得究竟，無煩無熱，常住不變，是聖所知、聖所見。
translated: This is called another present Dharma that can be attained to the end, free from vexation and heat, eternally abiding and unchanging, which is known by the sages and seen by the sages.
The Buddha spoke like this.

original: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
analyzed: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translated: Those bhikṣus, having heard the Buddha's words, rejoiced and practiced them.

original: 尼乾經第九竟三千六百20 波羅牢經（二〇）中阿含業相應品波羅牢經第十初一日誦我聞如是：
analyzed: 尼乾經第九竟三千六百20 波羅牢經（二〇）中阿含業相應品波羅牢經第十初一日誦我聞如是：
translated: The Sūtra of Poluo (20) In the Āgama Sutras, Chapter on Karma, Sūtra 10, First Day's Recitation I have heard this sort of thing:

original: 一時，佛遊拘麗瘦，與大比丘眾俱，往至北村，住北村北尸攝惒林中。
analyzed: 一時，佛遊拘麗瘦，與大比丘眾俱，往至北村，住北村北尸攝惒林中。
translated: Once, the Buddha was traveling in Kuru, together with a great assembly of bhikṣus, and went to the northern village, staying in the Śiṣṭhīvana forest north of the northern village.

original: 爾時，波羅牢伽彌尼聞沙門瞿曇釋種子，捨釋宗族，出家學道，遊拘麗瘦，與大比丘眾俱，至此北村，住北村北尸攝惒林中。
analyzed: 爾時，波羅牢伽彌尼聞沙門瞿曇釋種子，捨釋宗族，出家學道，遊拘麗瘦，與大比丘眾俱，至此北村，住北村北尸攝惒林中。
translated: At that time, the head of the clan, Parāśara, heard that the śramaṇa Gautama, the son of the Śākya clan, had renounced his Śākya family and gone forth to study the path. He was traveling in Kuru and Kāśi, together with a large assembly of bhikṣus, and had arrived at this northern village, staying in the Śiṣṭa Grove north of the northern village.

original: 彼沙門瞿曇有大名稱，周聞十方，沙門瞿曇如來、無所著、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，號佛、眾祐。
analyzed: 彼沙門瞿曇有大名稱，周聞十方，沙門瞿曇如來、無所著、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，號佛、眾祐。
translated: That śramaṇa Gautama has a great reputation that is heard in the ten directions. The śramaṇa Gautama is a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, with perfect knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed one, a trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, and a Bhagavān.

original: 彼於此世，天及魔、梵、沙門、梵志，從人至天，自知自覺，自作證成就遊，彼若說法，初善、中善、竟亦善，有義有文，具足清淨，顯現梵行。
analyzed: 彼於此世，天及魔、梵、沙門、梵志，從人至天，自知自覺，自作證成就遊，彼若說法，初善、中善、竟亦善，有義有文，具足清淨，顯現梵行。
translated: He, in this world, together with gods, Māras, Brahmās, śramaṇas, brāhmans, from humans to gods, knows and realizes it himself, and achieves it himself. If he teaches the Dharma, it is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with meaning and phrasing, complete and pure, revealing the holy life.

original: 若見如來、無所著、等正覺，尊重禮拜，供養承事者，快得善利。
analyzed: 若見如來、無所著、等正覺，尊重禮拜，供養承事者，快得善利。
translated: If one sees the Tathāgata, the Worthy of Offerings, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and respectfully pays homage and makes offerings to him, one will quickly obtain great benefits.
He thought like this:
I should go and see the ascetic Gautama!
I should serve and make offerings to him.

original: 」波羅牢伽彌尼聞已，從北村出，北行至尸攝惒林，欲見世尊禮事供養。
analyzed: 」波羅牢伽彌尼聞已，從北村出，北行至尸攝惒林，欲見世尊禮事供養。
translated: Having heard this, the head of the Po-luo clan left the northern village and went north to the Śi-chè-hū Forest, wishing to see the World-Honored One and make offerings to him.

original: 波羅牢伽彌尼遙見世尊在林樹間，端正姝好，猶星中月，光曜暐曄，晃若金山，相好具足，威神巍巍，諸根寂定，無有蔽礙，成就調御，息心靜默。
analyzed: 波羅牢伽彌尼遙見世尊在林樹間，端正姝好，猶星中月，光曜暐曄，晃若金山，相好具足，威神巍巍，諸根寂定，無有蔽礙，成就調御，息心靜默。
translated: From afar, the head of the Po-luo clan saw the World-Honored One among the trees in the forest, upright and beautiful like the moon among the stars, shining brightly like a golden mountain, with all the major and minor marks complete, majestic and lofty, his faculties tranquil and restrained, without obstruction, accomplished and disciplined, his mind at peace and silent.

original: 波羅牢伽彌尼遙見佛已，前至佛所，共相問訊，却坐一面，白世尊曰：
analyzed: 波羅牢伽彌尼遙見佛已，前至佛所，共相問訊，却坐一面，白世尊曰：
translated: Having seen the Buddha from afar, the head of the Po-luo clan went to where the Buddha was, exchanged greetings, sat to one side, and said to the World-Honored One:

original: 「我聞沙門瞿曇知幻是幻，瞿曇！
analyzed: 「我聞沙門瞿曇知幻是幻，瞿曇！
translated: I have heard that the ascetic Gautama knows illusions as illusions. Gautama!

original: 若如是說，沙門瞿曇知幻是幻，彼不謗毀沙門瞿曇耶？
analyzed: 若如是說，沙門瞿曇知幻是幻，彼不謗毀沙門瞿曇耶？
translated: If it is said like this, does it not slander the ascetic Gotama, that he knows an illusion to be an illusion?

original: 彼說真實耶？🔽彼說是法耶？
analyzed: 彼說真實耶？ 彼說是法耶？
translated: Is what he says true?🔽Is what he says the Dharma?
Does he teach the Dharma as it really is?
Is there no fault or difficulty in what is in accordance with the Dharma?
The World-Honored One replied:
Gambhira,

original: 若如是說，沙門瞿曇知幻是幻，彼不謗毀沙門瞿曇！
analyzed: 若如是說，沙門瞿曇知幻是幻，彼不謗毀沙門瞿曇！
translated: if it is said like this, it does not slander the ascetic Gotama, that he knows an illusion to be an illusion.

original: 彼說真實，彼說是法，彼說法如法，於法無過，亦無難詰。
analyzed: 彼說真實，彼說是法，彼說法如法，於法無過，亦無難詰。
translated: What he says is true, what he says is the Dharma, he teaches the Dharma as it really is, there is no fault or difficulty in what is in accordance with the Dharma.
Why is it so?
Gambhira,
I know that to be an illusion, but I myself am not an illusion.
Pārāyaṇa said:

original: 「彼沙門、梵志所說真實，而我不信彼說沙門瞿曇知幻是幻。
analyzed: 「彼沙門、梵志所說真實，而我不信彼說沙門瞿曇知幻是幻。
translated: What those ascetics and brahmins say is true, but I do not believe what they say about the ascetic Gotama knowing an illusion to be an illusion.
The World-Honored One said:
Gambhira,
If one knows the illusion, is one then the illusion?
Poluo Lamu said:
It is so.
World-Honored One!
It is so.
Well-Gone One!
The World-Honored One said:
Gāmaṇi!

original: 汝莫自誤，謗毀於我，若謗毀我者，則便自損。
analyzed: 汝莫自誤，謗毀於我，若謗毀我者，則便自損。
translated: Do not deceive yourself and slander me. If you slander me, you will only harm yourself.

original: 有諍有犯，聖賢所惡，而得大罪。
analyzed: 有諍有犯，聖賢所惡，而得大罪。
translated: There is contention and transgression, which is abhorred by the sages and virtuous ones, and one will incur great offenses.
Why is it so?
This is not really as you have said.
Gāmaṇi!
Have you heard of the executioners in Kuru?
He replied:
I have heard of them.
Gāmaṇi!
What do you think?
What is the use of the executioners in Kuru?
He replied:
Gautama!

original: 通使殺賊，為此事故，拘麗瘦畜是卒也。
analyzed: 通使殺賊，為此事故，拘麗瘦畜是卒也。
translated: It is for the purpose of killing and plundering that Kuru keeps these executioners.
Gāmaṇi!
What do you think?

original: 拘麗瘦卒為有戒，為無戒耶？
analyzed: 拘麗瘦卒為有戒，為無戒耶？
translated: Was the executioner Kūlanāma virtuous or not?
He replied:
Gautama!

original: 若世間有無戒德者，無過拘麗瘦卒。
analyzed: 若世間有無戒德者，無過拘麗瘦卒。
translated: If there are those in the world who are not virtuous, none surpasses the executioner Kūlanāma.
Why is this?

original: 拘麗瘦卒極犯禁戒，唯行惡法。
analyzed: 拘麗瘦卒極犯禁戒，唯行惡法。
translated: The executioner Kūlanāma was extremely unvirtuous, only practicing evil dharmas.
He asked again:
Headman!

original: 汝如是見、如是知，我不問汝，若他問汝：
analyzed: 汝如是見、如是知，我不問汝，若他問汝：
translated: I will not ask you about this, but if others ask you:

original: 『波羅牢伽彌尼知拘麗瘦卒極犯禁戒，唯行惡法，因此事故，波羅牢伽彌尼極犯禁戒，唯行惡法。
analyzed: 『波羅牢伽彌尼知拘麗瘦卒極犯禁戒，唯行惡法，因此事故，波羅牢伽彌尼極犯禁戒，唯行惡法。
translated: 'The headman Pāyāsi knows that the executioner Kūlanāma was extremely unvirtuous, only practicing evil dharmas. For this reason, the headman Pāyāsi is also extremely unvirtuous, only practicing evil dharmas.'
If you speak like this, is it true?
He replied:
No, it is not so.
Gautama!
Why is this?

original: 拘麗瘦卒見異、欲異，所願亦異，拘麗瘦卒極犯禁戒，唯行惡法；
analyzed: 拘麗瘦卒見異、欲異，所願亦異，拘麗瘦卒極犯禁戒，唯行惡法；
translated: The executioner Kūlanāma had different views and desires, and his aspirations were also different. The executioner Kūlanāma was extremely unvirtuous, only practicing evil dharmas;
I am extremely virtuous and do not engage in evil dharmas.
He asked again:
Headman,

original: 汝知拘麗瘦卒極犯禁戒，唯行惡法，然不以此為犯禁戒，唯行惡法；
analyzed: 汝知拘麗瘦卒極犯禁戒，唯行惡法，然不以此為犯禁戒，唯行惡法；
translated: you know that the Kālāmas are extremely immoral and only engage in evil dharmas, yet you do not consider this to be immoral and only evil;

original: 如來何以不得知幻而自非幻？
analyzed: 如來何以不得知幻而自非幻？
translated: how can the Tathāgata not know illusion and yet not be illusory himself?
Why is this?

original: 我知幻，知幻人，知幻報，知斷幻。
analyzed: 我知幻，知幻人，知幻報，知斷幻。
translated: I know illusion, I know the illusory person, I know the retribution of illusion, and I know the cessation of illusion.
Headman,

original: 我亦知殺生，知殺生人，知殺生報，知斷殺生。
analyzed: 我亦知殺生，知殺生人，知殺生報，知斷殺生。
translated: I also know killing, I know the killer, I know the retribution of killing, and I know the cessation of killing.
Headman,

original: 我知不與取，知不與取人，知不與取報，知斷不與取。
analyzed: 我知不與取，知不與取人，知不與取報，知斷不與取。
translated: I know stealing, I know the thief, I know the retribution of stealing, and I know the cessation of stealing.
Headman,

original: 我知妄言，知妄言人，知妄言報，知斷妄言。
analyzed: 我知妄言，知妄言人，知妄言報，知斷妄言。
translated: I know false speech, I know the liar, I know the retribution of false speech, and I know the cessation of false speech.
Headman,
I know in this way, I see in this way.

original: 若有作是說，沙門瞿曇知幻即是幻者，彼未斷此語，聞彼心、彼欲、彼願、彼聞、彼念、彼觀，如屈伸臂頃，命終生地獄中。
analyzed: 若有作是說，沙門瞿曇知幻即是幻者，彼未斷此語，聞彼心、彼欲、彼願、彼聞、彼念、彼觀，如屈伸臂頃，命終生地獄中。
translated: If there are those who say, 'The ascetic Gotama knows magic and is himself a magician,' their words will not be cut off. Hearing their thoughts, desires, wishes, what they have heard, what they have contemplated, and what they have observed, they will die within the twinkling of an eye and be reborn in hell.

original: 」波羅牢伽彌尼聞已，怖懼戰慄，身毛皆竪，即從坐起，頭面禮足，長跪叉手，白世尊曰：
analyzed: 」波羅牢伽彌尼聞已，怖懼戰慄，身毛皆竪，即從坐起，頭面禮足，長跪叉手，白世尊曰：
translated: Having heard this, the headman Poluo was frightened, trembling, and his hair stood on end. He immediately rose from his seat, bowed his head to the Buddha's feet, knelt for a long time with palms joined, and said to the World-Honored One:
I repent, Gautama!
From ancient times, Well-Gone One!

original: 如愚、如癡、如不定、如不善。
analyzed: 如愚、如癡、如不定、如不善。
translated: I was like a fool, like an idiot, like one who is unstable and unskillful.
Why is it so?

original: 我以妄說沙門瞿曇是幻，唯願瞿曇受我悔過，見罪發露，我悔過已，護不更作。
analyzed: 我以妄說沙門瞿曇是幻，唯願瞿曇受我悔過，見罪發露，我悔過已，護不更作。
translated: I falsely said that the ascetic Gautama is a magician. I only wish that Gautama would accept my repentance, see my faults and confess them. After I have repented, I will guard against doing it again.
The World-Honored One said:
So it is, headman!

original: 汝實如愚、如癡、如不定、如不善。
analyzed: 汝實如愚、如癡、如不定、如不善。
translated: You really are foolish, ignorant, unstable, and unskillful.
Why is that?

original: 謂汝於如來、無所著、等正覺妄說是幻。
analyzed: 謂汝於如來、無所著、等正覺妄說是幻。
translated: It is because you falsely claimed that the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One is an illusion.

original: 然汝能悔過，見罪發露，護不更作。
analyzed: 然汝能悔過，見罪發露，護不更作。
translated: However, you are able to repent, see your faults, confess, and vow not to commit them again.
In this way, headman,

original: 若有悔過，見罪發露，護不更作者，則長養聖法而無有失。
analyzed: 若有悔過，見罪發露，護不更作者，則長養聖法而無有失。
translated: if one repents, sees their faults, confesses, and vows not to commit them again, then the noble Dharma grows and does not decline.

original: 」於是，波羅牢伽彌尼叉手向佛，白世尊曰：
analyzed: 」於是，波羅牢伽彌尼叉手向佛，白世尊曰：
translated: Then the headman Poluo, with palms joined towards the Buddha, said to the World-Honored One:
Gautama!

original: 有一沙門梵志如是見、如是說：
analyzed: 有一沙門梵志如是見、如是說：
translated: There are some renunciants and brahmins who hold this view and speak thus:

original: 『若有殺生者，彼一切即於現法受報，因彼生憂苦；
analyzed: 『若有殺生者，彼一切即於現法受報，因彼生憂苦；
translated: 'If there are those who kill living beings, all of them will experience retribution in the present life, and because of that, they will give rise to distress and suffering;

original: 若有不與取、妄言，彼一切即於現法受報，因彼生憂苦。
analyzed: 若有不與取、妄言，彼一切即於現法受報，因彼生憂苦。
translated: if there are those who take what is not given, speak falsely, all of them will experience retribution in the present life, and because of that, they will give rise to distress and suffering.'
Śramaṇa Gautama!
What do you think about this?
The World-Honored One said:
Gambhira,
I will now ask you, answer as you see fit.
Gambhira,
what do you think?

original: 若村邑中，或有一人，頭冠華鬘，雜香塗身，而作倡樂，歌舞自娛，唯作女妓，歡樂如王。
analyzed: 若村邑中，或有一人，頭冠華鬘，雜香塗身，而作倡樂，歌舞自娛，唯作女妓，歡樂如王。
translated: If in a village, there is a person who wears a flower garland on their head, anoints their body with various fragrances, entertains themselves by singing and dancing, and only performs as a female entertainer, enjoying themselves like a king.
If someone asks:

original: 『此人本作何等，今頭冠華鬘，雜香塗身，而作倡樂，歌舞自娛，唯作女妓，歡樂如王？
analyzed: 『此人本作何等，今頭冠華鬘，雜香塗身，而作倡樂，歌舞自娛，唯作女妓，歡樂如王？
translated: 'What did this person do in the past, that now they wear a flower garland on their head, anoint their body with various fragrances, entertain themselves by singing and dancing, only perform as a female entertainer, and enjoy themselves like a king?'
Perhaps someone answers:

original: 『此人為王殺害怨家，王歡喜已，即與賞賜，是以此人頭冠華鬘，雜香塗身，而作倡樂，歌舞自娛，唯作女妓，歡樂如王。
analyzed: 『此人為王殺害怨家，王歡喜已，即與賞賜，是以此人頭冠華鬘，雜香塗身，而作倡樂，歌舞自娛，唯作女妓，歡樂如王。
translated: 'This person killed the king's enemy for the king. The king was delighted and immediately bestowed rewards upon them. Therefore, this person wears a flower garland on their head, anoints their body with various fragrances, entertains themselves by singing and dancing, only performs as a female entertainer, and enjoys themselves like a king.'
Gambhira,
Have you seen and heard this, or not?
He replied:
I have seen it.
Gautama!
I have heard it before and will hear it again.
Gamini!

original: 又復見王收捕罪人，反縛兩手，打鼓唱令，出南城門，坐高標下而梟其首。
analyzed: 又復見王收捕罪人，反縛兩手，打鼓唱令，出南城門，坐高標下而梟其首。
translated: Again, you have seen the king capture criminals, tie their hands behind their back, beat the drum and proclaim, take them out the southern gate, sit them under a tall signpost, and behead them.
If there are those who ask:
'What crime did this person commit that they were executed by the king?'
There may be some who answer:

original: 『此人枉殺王家無過之人，是以王教如是行刑。
analyzed: 『此人枉殺王家無過之人，是以王教如是行刑。
translated: 'This person unjustly killed an innocent person of the king's family, and for this reason the king ordered this execution.'
Gamini!
Have you seen and heard this, or not?
He replied:
I have seen it.
Gautama!
I have heard it before and will hear it again.
Gamini!

original: 若有沙門、梵志如是見、如是說：
analyzed: 若有沙門、梵志如是見、如是說：
translated: If there are ascetics and brahmins who see and say this:

original: 『若有殺生，彼一切即於現法受報，因彼生憂苦。
analyzed: 『若有殺生，彼一切即於現法受報，因彼生憂苦。

Gāmaṇi!

analyzed: 汝自無淨智，為有後世，為無後世？
translated: You yourself do not have pure knowledge, whether there is an afterlife or not.

translated: There is a concentration called 'separation', by means of this concentration, you can attain right mindfulness, you can attain one-pointedness of mind.

translated: He then sees for himself that he has abandoned the ten unwholesome courses of action and contemplates the ten wholesome courses of action.

translated: Having seen for himself that he has abandoned the ten unwholesome courses of action and contemplated the ten wholesome courses of action, he then gives rise to joy, having given rise to joy he then gives rise to happiness, having given rise to happiness he then calms the body, having calmed the body he then experiences bliss in the body, having experienced bliss in the body he then attains one-pointedness of mind.

translated: In the same way, in the second, third, and fourth directions, the intermediate directions, above and below, everywhere throughout the world, his mind accompanied with loving-kindness, without knots, without enmity, without ill-will, without rivalry, he dwells pervading the entire world boundless, exalted, immeasurable, and well cultivated.
He thinks like this:

original: 『若有沙門、梵志如是見、如是說，無施無齋，無有呪說，無善惡業，無善惡業報，無此世彼世，無父無母，世無真人往至善處，善去善向，此世彼世，自知自覺，自作證成就遊。
analyzed: 『若有沙門、梵志如是見、如是說，無施無齋，無有呪說，無善惡業，無善惡業報，無此世彼世，無父無母，世無真人往至善處，善去善向，此世彼世，自知自覺，自作證成就遊。
translated: 'If there are ascetics and brahmins who hold this view and speak thus: There is no giving, no sacrifice, no offerings, no good conduct, no bad conduct, no results of good or bad actions, there is no this world or next world, there are no mother or father, there are no ascetics or brahmins who attain the path and practice the path, who having realized this world and the next world, proclaim it and teach it,

original: 若彼沙門、梵志所說真實者，我不犯世怖與不怖，常當慈愍一切世間，我心不與眾生共諍，無濁歡悅。
analyzed: 若彼沙門、梵志所說真實者，我不犯世怖與不怖，常當慈愍一切世間，我心不與眾生共諍，無濁歡悅。
translated: if what they say is true, then I have not committed any offense in the world, whether in fear or without fear. I should always have loving-kindness for the whole world. My mind should not be in conflict with beings, without defilements, and joyful.

original: 我今得無上人上之法，昇進得安樂居，謂遠離法定。
analyzed: 我今得無上人上之法，昇進得安樂居，謂遠離法定。
translated: I have now attained the unsurpassed human and superhuman qualities, and have progressed to attain a blissful state, namely the concentration of the mind on seclusion.

original: 彼沙門、梵志所說，不是不非。
analyzed: 彼沙門、梵志所說，不是不非。
translated: What the ascetics and brahmins say is neither entirely true nor entirely false.
Having realized that it is neither entirely true nor entirely false, I attained inner tranquility.
O Ghaṭīkāra!

original: 是謂法定，名曰遠離，汝因此定，可得正念，可得一心，如是汝於現法便斷疑惑，而得昇進。

translated: This is called the concentration of the mind on seclusion. By this concentration, you can attain right mindfulness and one-pointedness of mind. In this way, you will in this very life cut off doubts and attain progress.

translated: The well-versed noble disciple, having abandoned killing, abstains from killing, abstains from taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech, up to abandoning wrong view and attaining right view. analyzed: 』彼便自見，我斷十惡業道，念十善業道。
translated: They will then see themselves abandoning the ten unwholesome courses of action and contemplating the ten wholesome courses of action.

translated: Having seen themselves abandoning the ten unwholesome courses of action and contemplating the ten wholesome courses of action, they will give rise to joy, having given rise to joy they will give rise to rapture, having given rise to rapture their body will become tranquil, having a tranquil body they will experience bliss, and having experienced bliss their mind will enter concentration.

original: 多聞聖弟子得一心已，則心與悲俱，遍滿一方成就遊。
analyzed: 多聞聖弟子得一心已，則心與悲俱，遍滿一方成就遊。
translated: When the well-versed noble disciple has attained concentration, their mind will be filled with compassion, pervading one direction and being accomplished in dwelling.

there are good and bad actions, and there are retributions for good and bad actions;
there is this world and the next world, there are fathers and mothers;

original: 我得無上人上之法，昇進得安樂居，謂遠離法定。

translated: I have attained the Dharma of a supreme person, and I have progressed to attain a blissful state, namely the concentration of the Dharma of seclusion.

analyzed: 彼沙門、梵志所說不是不非。
translated: What those ascetics and brahmins say is neither wrong nor not wrong.

translated: If what the śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas say is true, then I have not committed any offense, whether it be a worldly fear or not a fear. I should always have compassion for all worlds. I have attained the Dharma of the supreme human, and I progress and attain happiness, namely the concentration of the Dharma of seclusion.
